intro: Sebastiania corniculata var. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in umbels. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
